COPY
Allied Record Mfg. Co.
619 w. 5toh Street
New York 19, N.Y.
September 11, 1952
Mr. Prank Schooley, Treasurer,
Dept. BT
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooleys
We have noted with great Interest your entry into the transcribed
radio field and want to congratulate you. I am only sorry that
we did not have the opportunity of becoming acquainted before
because, as you can see from the enclosed literature, we have
a service which will be of great interest to you.
Allied is the oldest and largest custom manufacturer of
phonograph records and radio transcriptions in the field today, and
we are fortunate to number among our clients the greatest names and
most critical buyers in the industry.
I trust that you will find the enclosed material both interesting
and helpful and I will look forward to seeing you personally
sometime in November.
Mr. Schooley we are most interested In working out a satisfactory
contract with you, and we would very much like to hear from
you as to the details of your series; how many pressings
involved, method of shipment, etc. We could handle your
account either from Hollywood or New York.
Sincerely yours,
HONtes
Enel.
/s/ Hal 0. Neely
Hal 0* Neely
